summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for August 3, 2019, detailing routine prison operations, staffing shortages, and inmate counts. It is significant as it documents the prison's status the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, showing an inmate on suicide watch with a companion.

persons.name: Lt.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations Report
events.description: Routine daily activity at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York, noting staffing shortages leading to unassigned posts, an inmate on suicide watch with a companion, and inmate population totals.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The report is dated August 4, 2019, and covers activity for August 3, 2019, one week before Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
It notes an inmate was on suicide watch with an 'inmate companion' at the MCC New York.
Staffing shortages were reported on the day and evening watch shifts, leading to unassigned correctional officer posts in key areas like 10 South and the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
The total inmate population at the MCC New York at the beginning of the morning watch shift on August 3, 2019, was 761.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) document series related to the Epstein case.
